newsitem.title: USA: Swift Energy sees record production ahead.
newsitem.headline: Swift Energy sees record production ahead.

text.p: Swift Energy Co on Thursday predicted that it would register a record year of production, earnings, and cash flow in 1997.

In addition, the company said it plans to drill about 100 more wells in its AWP Olmos field in McMullen County, Texas, by the end of the year, and 300 to 350 additional wells during the next few years.

The AWP Olmos field has become one of the focal points of the company's development drilling program. During the first quarter of 1997, Swift drilled and placed on production 49 gross (38.8 net) wells in the field.

"Industry economic conditions remain excellent, despite recent seasonal weakness in oil and gas prices. As a result, Swift expects to register another record year of production, earnings, and cash flow in 1997 and to achieve continued gains in the years ahead," said company president A. Earl Swift.
Swift Energy Co is an independent oil and gas company engaged in the exploration, development, acquisition, and operation of oil and gas properties.
